revised_title: Magnetic Shaping of Molten Metal Columns: Applications and Techniques
tldr: This article explores the use of magnetic fields to shape molten metal columns in continuous casting processes. The author presents a mathematical model and numerical methods to analyze the effects of surface tension and magnetic pressure on the shape of the molten metal column. The study covers various scenarios, including uniform and quadrupole magnetic fields, and provides insights into the potential applications and techniques for improving the efficiency of continuous casting in the metallurgical industry.
